headline: What The Latest Analyst Revisions Mean For New Oriental Education's Evolving Investment Story
summary: New Oriental Education & Technology Group’s latest research update leaves its fair value estimate steady at about $64.49 per share, but reflects a slightly higher discount rate as analysts recalibrate risk and return expectations. The modest tweaks in long term revenue growth assumptions stem from stronger than expected top line momentum and improving earnings visibility, even as cautious voices flag potential headwinds in overseas markets and regulation. Read on to see how these shifting...

headline: Emerging Markets Bring High Hopes for 2026 After Stellar Year
summary: For the first time since 2017, emerging stocks are outperforming US peers, the gap between its bond yields and those of US Treasuries have shrunk to the lowest in 11 years and carry trade strategies — which largely consist of borrowing in a lower-yielding asset to fund purchases in higher-yielding ones — have reaped the best profits since 2009.  Enthusiasm for the sector was on full view at Bank of America Corp.’s recent investment conference in London.  The bank hosted 300 investors and 170 meetings, and found hardly any pessimism on emerging markets.

headline: Burry’s Massive Puts vs. a Street‑High $255 Target From Bank of America – Who Should You Follow?
summary: Michael Burry has been butting heads with the bulls on Wall Street, specifically regarding Palantir (NASDAQ:PLTR). The bulls have won big so far, and the price targets have gotten even bolder. On the other hand, most analysts are sitting on the fence with a “Hold” rating, with three analysts having “Sell” ratings on the stock. ... Burry’s Massive Puts vs. a Street‑High $255 Target From Bank of America – Who Should You Follow?
